alert.note: Alert for Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 2:06PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Union County, Union, northern Ouachita and northeastern Lincoln Parishes through 300 PM CDT... At 206 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lawson to 10 miles northeast of Ruston. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Claiborne, West Monroe, Huttig, Swartz, Farmerville, Sterlington, Strong, Urbana, Lawson, Lapile, Marion, Felsenthal, Downsville, Spearsville, Drew, D Arbonne, New London, Oakland and Haile. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
